keyTakeAways: Former President Joe Biden completed a course of radiation therapy for aggressive prostate cancer that had spread to his bones.
He began a pill regimen earlier in the year as part of his treatment plan.
Biden underwent Mohs surgery earlier this year for skin cancer, indicating a broader treatment journey.

Biden remains publicly engaged, with plans to speak at events in Boston and Omaha despite his illness.

summaryOfNewsArticle: Former President Joe Biden has completed a course of radiation therapy for an aggressive form of prostate cancer that had spread to his bones. He previously began a pill regimen and underwent Mohs surgery for skin cancer. The treatment journey, including public updates from his daughter Ashley and visits to Penn Medicine Radiation Oncology in Philadelphia, has drawn global attention. Despite his illness, Biden remains active in public life, with upcoming speaking engagements at the Edward M. Kennedy Institute and for the Nebraska Democratic Party, highlighting both his resilience and the broader public interest in how political leaders manage serious health conditions.
